author: Epoch Times Staff
description: A glimpse into the world through the lens of photography.
title: Day in Photos: 105-Year-Old Royal Marines Veteran, Heatwave in Europe, and Grouse Hunting Season

author: Emel Akan
description: Karoline Leavitt said there were many locations considered for the summit with Putin but that Trump was “honored” to host the Russian president on U.S. soil.
title: Trump to Hold Virtual Meeting With Zelenskyy Ahead of Summit With Putin

author: Adam Morrow
description: The U.S. president has suggested the meeting could see some ‘land-swapping,’ raising concerns in Kyiv and Brussels.
title: Trump–Putin Summit Faces Longstanding Sticking Points

author: Jennifer Cowan
description: Ontario’s top court has upheld a judgment that determined Ukraine International Airlines is legally obligated to provide full compensation to the families of the victims who died when Flight PS752 was shot down in 2020. The jetliner, bound for Canada via Ukraine, was downed by two Iranian missiles just minutes after taking off from Tehran […]
title: Court Affirms Decision Mandating Airline Compensate Families of Flight PS752 Victims

author: Noé Chartier
description: News Analysis With the nature of the trade deals struck by U.S. President Donald Trump in recent weeks, P.E.I. Premier Rob Lantz said it’s better that Canada remains without one. The Trump deals have maintained a baseline level of tariffs on trading partners, have mostly kept in place the steep sectoral tariffs, and have included […]
title: No Trade Deal With US Yet? Why PEI Premier Says That May Be a Good Thing

author: The Canadian Press
description: Officials have asked residents near the capital of Newfoundland and Labrador to evacuate as a wildfire burns nearby. The provincial government says people living in parts of the Paradise suburb must leave immediately. Paradise is part of the St. John’s metropolitan area, and home to about 23,000 people. Officials have also declared a state of […]
title: Evacuations Ordered as Wildfire Roars Near Newfoundland’s Largest City

author: The Canadian Press
description: One heat-related death has been reported to Montreal’s public health department since a period of extreme heat hit the city on Sunday. Department spokesman Tudor Matei says the city’s health agency has been notified of five other heat-related deaths this year, when temperatures soared in late June. Montreal’s public health department asks emergency room doctors […]
title: Montreal Public Health Says One Heat-Related Death Reported Since Sunday

author: Chandra Philip
description: Group behind the billboard says decision violates Charter rights, will challenge order
title: Hamilton Mayor Orders Billboard Opposing Medical Gender Transition for Minors Taken Down

author: The Canadian Press
description: A 23-year-old man has been charged in the assault of a Jewish father at a Montreal park last week. The incident, captured on a 28-second video shared widely online, drew swift condemnation including from Prime Minister Mark Carney and Quebec Premier François Legault. Sergio Yanes Preciado is facing a charge of assault causing bodily harm, […]
title: Man Charged With Assault After Attack on Jewish Father in Montreal Caught on Video

author: Michael Zhuang
description: Once a trendy fixture in shopping malls across China, Russian goods stores—known for selling snacks, crafts, and souvenirs marketed as authentic imports—are closing in droves. In less than a year, the fad has gone from rapid expansion to mass liquidation, leaving empty storefronts in major commercial hubs nationwide. The boom coincided with the early months […]
title: Russia-Themed Stores Closing Down Across China as Propaganda-Driven Retail Craze Fades

author: Ryan Morgan
description: The signatories wrote that 'lethal force must not be used at distribution sites, and civilians, humanitarians and medical workers must be protected.'
title: 26 Foreign Ministers Call for New Flood of Aid to Gaza, Amid Famine Concerns

author: Jennifer Cowan
description: St. Joseph’s Hospital in London, Ont., has discontinued its use of dogs in cardiac research after recent media reports indicating the hospital’s research institute induced heart attacks in the animals for study purposes. The Lawson Research Institute at St. Joseph’s Health Care announced on Aug. 11 that it will no longer use dogs as part […]
title: Ontario Hospital Halts Controversial Dog Research Amid Public Outcry

author: Olivia Gomm
description: The RCMP is creating a “drone corridor” along the Canada-U.S. border in the prairies in an effort to improve border security by detecting illegal border crossings and smugglers. Drones, referred to by the RCMP as Remotely Piloted Aircraft System (RPAS), will patrol along the Canada-U.S. border in Alberta, Saskatchewan, and Manitoba within Canadian airspace, the […]
title: RCMP Sets Up ‘Drone Corridor’ at Border to Boost Security

author: Danny Randell
description: Commentary Will the 21st century be marked by the flourishing of democracy or its decline? The latter seems more likely, according to Andrew Coyne’s latest book, “The Crisis of Canadian Democracy” (Sutherland House). The word “crisis” can be overused, but it is warranted here. Canadians tend to level criticism at places farther afield, yet fail to […]
title: ‘The Crisis of Canadian Democracy’: Book Review

author: Alex Wu
description: Authorities have released millions of mosquitoes in a disease-control program, but China is now experiencing its largest Chikungunya outbreak.
title: Chinese Authorities Mandating Blood Tests, Releasing Lab Mosquitoes to Fight Chikungunya Outbreak

author: Andrew Moran
description: 'Origin washing' has become a common practice in international trade.
title: An Anatomy of Transshipment—Here’s What to Know About the Tariff Evasion Strategy

author: Noé Chartier
description: The Canadian Armed Forces (CAF) are taking part in several summer operations in a bid to reinforce sovereignty in the Arctic. The activities span across the northern region and involve personnel and equipment from the navy, the army, the air force, and special operations. Some of the drills will be conducted jointly with the Canadian […]
title: Canadian Military Takes Part in Arctic Operations in Defence of ‘North American Homeland’

author: The Canadian Press
description: The union representing around 10,000 Air Canada flight attendants could signal its intent to strike if a deal isn’t reached by the end of today. The earliest that flight attendants could potentially walk off the job is Saturday at 12:01 a.m. ET. Since the union must provide 72-hours notice if it plans to strike, that […]
title: Air Canada Flight Attendants Could Serve Strike Notice After Midnight Tonight

author: Jennifer Cowan
description: The Parti Québécois (PQ) has secured its third successive byelection win in Quebec, solidifying the momentum of the sovereigntist party as it approaches the 2026 provincial election. The PQ victory by former Radio-Canada journalist Alex Boissonneault in the riding of Arthabaska on Aug. 11 is a setback to Premier François Legault’s ruling Coalition Avenir Québec […]
title: PQ Momentum Grows After Win in Quebec’s Arthabaska Byelection

author: Dorothy Li
description: Beijing's new measures came weeks after Canada unveiled plans aimed at bolstering its steel industry against a flood of cheap products from China.
title: China Sets Steep Duties on Canadian Canola Imports, Opens New Probe

author: Epoch Video
description: Japan’s Nikkei average share gauge climbs to a record high in early trade on Aug. 12, following similar gains this year by other global indexes.
title: REPLAY: Japan’s Nikkei Share Gauge Hits Record High

author: Victoria Friedman
description: Lee's trip will be his first visit to Washington since he took office following a snap election in June.
title: Trump, South Korean President to Hold Economic, Security Summit

author: Epoch Video
description: South Africa’s Minister of Agriculture John Steenhuisen and Minister of Trade, Industry and Competition Mpho Parks Tau jointly brief the media at 2:20 a.m. ET on Aug. 12 in Johannesburg, South Africa, on the outcomes of the Cabinet decisions regarding South Africa’s response to the unilateral tariffs imposed by the United States.
title: REPLAY: South African Ministers Brief Media on US Tariffs

author: Chris Summers
description: A European Union statement published on Tuesday said the 'path to peace' cannot be decided without Ukraine's participation.
title: EU Urges Trump to Defend Europe’s Security Interests at Putin Summit

author: Owen Evans
description: The world’s largest offshore wind developer is grappling with 'recent material adverse developments in the US offshore wind market.'
title: Orsted Shares Hit Record Low as Offshore Wind Giant Seeks $9.4 Billion for US Project

author: Zachary Stieber
description: The study looked for links between exposure to aluminum and 50 disorders, including autism spectrum disorder.
title: Medical Journal Rejects RFK Jr.’s Call to Retract Paper

author: The Associated Press
description: DAKAR, Senegal—It’s the largest piece of Mars ever found on Earth—a 54-pound meteorite that fetched more than $5 million at a New York auction last month, setting a world record. But in the West African nation of Niger, where the rusty-red rock was unearthed in the Sahara Desert, officials have launched an investigation into what […]
title: Why Niger Is Investigating the $5 Million Sale of the Largest Mars Rock Found on Earth

author: Naziya Alvi Rahman
description: Defence Minister Richard Marles also handed over 12 up-armoured LandCruisers, worth $3 million built specifically for PNG’s defence needs.
title: Australia Opens New PNG Naval Base Amid $300 Million Cost Blowout

author: The Associated Press
description: Soccer great Cristiano Ronaldo and his long-term partner Georgina Rodriguez are engaged. The 31-year-old Rodríguez announced the happy news on Instagram on Monday with a photograph showing a huge ring on her finger. “Yes, I do,” read the caption in Spanish. “In this and in all my lives.” Rodríguez and the 40-year-old Ronaldo have two […]
title: Happy Move for Cristiano Ronaldo as Georgina Rodríguez Announces Their Engagement

author: Naziya Alvi Rahman
description: Ley sad a Coalition government would only recognise a Palestinian State at the conclusion of a proper peace process.
title: Coalition Vows to Reverse Labor’s Palestinian State Recognition

author: Alicia Márquez
description: The seizure of land near its borders threatens thousands of livelihoods and creates major risks for foreign investment, according to the State department.
title: US State Department Cautions Against Investments in Nicaragua After Border Land Grab

author: Naziya Alvi Rahman
description: The board said there is now more clarity on US tariffs and global policy responses, making extreme scenarios less likely.
title: RBA Cuts Cash Rate to 3.6 Percent

author: Naziya Alvi Rahman
description: Heroin was the top contributor, linked to 248 deaths.
title: Victoria Records Highest Overdose Deaths in a Decade

author: Naziya Alvi Rahman
description: SA reels from one of nation’s worst marine crises, prompting urgent action calls and a $28 million joint government response.
title: Albanese to Visit South Australia Over Algal Bloom Crisis

author: Naziya Alvi Rahman
description: An Israeli airstrike near Al Shifa Hospital killed 6 media workers, including journalist Anas al-Sharif.
title: Albanese Condemns Gaza Journalist Killings

author: Carolina Avendano
description: Saskatchewan’s Court of Appeal has ruled that a legal challenge to the province’s pronoun policy may proceed, finding that the government’s use of the notwithstanding clause does not prevent the court from assessing whether the law limits Charter rights. Chief Justice Robert W. Leurer concluded in an Aug. 11 ruling that the Court of King’s […]
title: Sask Court Says Legal Review of Pronoun Law May Proceed Despite Notwithstanding Clause

author: Monica O’Shea
description: Angus Taylor said there was no clarity that Hamas would be excluded from this future government or fully demilitarised.
title: Opposition Concerned Recognising Palestine State Is ‘Rewarding Terrorists’

author: Paul Rowan Brian
description: News Analysis A recent B.C. court decision granted title land rights to a First Nation group, bringing up questions of what this means for property rights in the province. The Aug. 7 decision by B.C. Supreme Court Justice Barbara Young is the culmination of a lawsuit filed in 2019 by Cowichan Nation, who successfully argued […]
title: What’s Next for Private Property in BC After First Nation Wins Title Land Rights in Vancouver

author: Lily Zhou
description: The USCG said it was monitoring five Chinese vessels as of Aug. 8, and responded to two in the U.S. Arctic region.
title: Increased Chinese Research Vessel Activity Detected in US Arctic, Coast Guard Says

author: Olivia Gomm
description: The Conservative Party is calling on the federal government to designate the India-based Lawrence Bishnoi gang as a terrorist organization. Conservative MP and public safety critic Frank Caputo wrote in an Aug. 11 letter to Public Safety Minister Gary Anandasangaree that the organization should be listed as a terrorist group under Canadian law to provide […]
title: Tories Say Bishnoi Gang Should Be Listed as Terrorist Organization

author: Paul Rowan Brian
description: Montreal police say they have arrested a 24-year-old man accused of attacking a Jewish father in front of his young children on Aug. 8. Investigation is still ongoing for the assault in which a Jewish man was beaten in front of his children, with police now releasing more details of what occurred as well as […]
title: Montreal Police Arrest Suspect in Assault on Jewish Father

author: Crystal-Rose Jones
description: The Australian and French leaders have joined the UK, Portugal and Canada in declaring recognition of a state of Palestine.
title: Macron Welcomes Australian PM’s Recognition of Palestinian State
